metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the unix-def:inetd_test is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evaluate to true if the interpreter properly supports unix-def:inetd_test.

criterion.comment: Test that the inetd_object is supported with the protocol entity equal to some value and the service_name entity equal to some value.
Test that the inetd_object is supported with the protocol entity not equal to some value and the service_name entity not equal to some value.
Test that the inetd_object is supported with the protocol entity matching some regular expression and the service_name entity matching some regular expression.

inetd_test.comment: Test that the inetd_object is supported with the protocol entity equal to some value and the service_name entity equal to some value.
Test that the inetd_object is supported with the protocol entity not equal to some value and the service_name entity not equal to some value.
Test that the inetd_object is supported with the protocol entity matching some regular expression and the service_name entity matching some regular expression.

inetd_object.comment: This inetd_object represents an inetd_item where the protocol equals 'tcp' and the service_name equals 'telnet'.
This inetd_object represents an inetd_item where the protocol is not equal to 'tcp' and the service_name is not equal to 'telnet'.
This inetd_object represents an inetd_item where the protocol matches the regular expression '^t.p$' and the service_name matches the regular expression '^te.n.t$'.

inetd_state.comment: This inetd_state represents an inetd_item which has a protocol equal to 'tcp' and a service_name equal to 'telnet'.
This inetd_state represents an inetd_item which has a protocol not equal to 'tcp' and a service_name not equal to 'telnet'.
This inetd_state represents an inetd_item which has a protocol that matches the regular expression '^t.p$' and a service_name that matches the regular expression '^te.n.t$'.
